options.responseData: Advanced scan started! This includes: subdomain enumeration, port scanning, HTTP probing, and vulnerability assessment.

nodes.name: Is Target a Domain?
nodes.notes: Detect if input is domain (for subdomain enum) or IP/network (direct scan)

parameters.command:
=# Install Security Tools
echo "Installing security tools..."

# Install Go (required for many tools)
if ! command -v go &> /dev/null; then
  echo "Installing Go..."
  apk add --no-cache go
fi

# Install subfinder
if ! command -v subfinder &> /dev/null; then
  echo "Installing subfinder..."
  go install -v github.com/projectdiscovery/subfinder/v2/cmd/subfinder@latest
  cp /root/go/bin/subfinder /usr/local/bin/
fi

# Install httpx
if ! command -v httpx &> /dev/null; then
  echo "Installing httpx..."
  go install -v github.com/projectdiscovery/httpx/cmd/httpx@latest
  cp /root/go/bin/httpx /usr/local/bin/
fi

# Install nuclei
if ! command -v nuclei &> /dev/null; then
  echo "Installing nuclei..."
  go install -v github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei/v3/cmd/nuclei@latest
  cp /root/go/bin/nuclei /usr/local/bin/
  nuclei -update-templates
fi

# Install amass
if ! command -v amass &> /dev/null; then
  echo "Installing amass..."
  go install -v github.com/owasp-amass/amass/v4/...@master
  cp /root/go/bin/amass /usr/local/bin/
fi

# dig and whois should be pre-installed, but check
apk add --no-cache bind-tools whois curl wget

echo "All tools installed successfully!"
echo "subfinder: $(subfinder -version 2>&1 | head -1)"
echo "httpx: $(httpx -version 2>&1 | head -1)"
echo "nuclei: $(nuclei -version 2>&1 | head -1)"
echo "amass: $(amass -version 2>&1 | head -1)"

nodes.name: Install Security Tools
nodes.notes: Install subfinder, httpx, nuclei, amass, dig, whois

parameters.command:
=# Whois Lookup for Domain Intelligence
whois {{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.target }} > /tmp/whois_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt
cat /tmp/whois_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt

nodes.name: Whois Lookup
nodes.notes: Gather domain registration and ownership info

parameters.command:
=# Subfinder - Fast subdomain enumeration
echo "Running subfinder on {{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.target }}..."
subfinder -d {{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.target }} -all -recursive -silent -o /tmp/subfinder_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt

echo "Subfinder found $(wc -l < /tmp/subfinder_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt) subdomains"
cat /tmp/subfinder_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt

nodes.name: Subfinder Subdomain Enum
nodes.notes: Fast subdomain discovery using multiple sources

parameters.command:
=# Amass - Comprehensive subdomain enumeration
echo "Running amass on {{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.target }}..."
amass enum -passive -d {{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.target }} -o /tmp/amass_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt

echo "Amass found $(wc -l < /tmp/amass_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt) subdomains"
cat /tmp/amass_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt

nodes.name: Amass Subdomain Enum
nodes.notes: Deep subdomain discovery and attack surface mapping

nodes.name: Merge & Deduplicate Subdomains
nodes.notes: Combine results from subfinder and amass

parameters.command:
=# DNS Resolution with dig
echo "Resolving {{ $json.count }} subdomains to IP addresses..."

# First write subdomains to file
echo '{{ $json.subdomainText }}' > /tmp/all_subdomains_{{ $json.timestamp }}.txt

# Read subdomains and resolve each
while IFS= read -r domain; do
  if [ -n "$domain" ]; then
    ip=$(dig +short "$domain" A | grep -E '^[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+$' | head -1)
    if [ -n "$ip" ]; then
      echo "${domain}|${ip}"
    fi
  fi
done < /tmp/all_subdomains_{{ $json.timestamp }}.txt > /tmp/resolved_{{ $json.timestamp }}.txt

echo "Resolved $(wc -l < /tmp/resolved_{{ $json.timestamp }}.txt) domains to IPs"
cat /tmp/resolved_{{ $json.timestamp }}.txt

nodes.name: DNS Resolution (dig)
nodes.notes: Resolve all subdomains to IP addresses

parameters.command:
=# HTTP Probing with httpx
echo "Probing subdomains for live HTTP services..."

# For domain path: probe subdomains
httpx -l /tmp/all_subdomains_{{ $json.timestamp }}.txt -silent -json -o /tmp/httpx_{{ $json.timestamp }}.json -threads 50 -timeout 10 -retries 2 -status-code -tech-detect -title -web-server -content-length -follow-redirects

echo "httpx found $(wc -l < /tmp/httpx_{{ $json.timestamp }}.json) live HTTP services"
cat /tmp/httpx_{{ $json.timestamp }}.json

nodes.name: HTTP Probing (httpx) - Domain
nodes.notes: Find live web services on subdomains

parameters.command:
=# Get unique IPs for nmap scanning
cat /tmp/resolved_{{ $('Merge & Deduplicate Subdomains').item.json.timestamp }}.txt | cut -d'|' -f2 | sort -u > /tmp/target_ips_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt

echo "Unique IPs to scan: $(wc -l < /tmp/target_ips_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt)"
cat /tmp/target_ips_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt | tr '\n' ',' | sed 's/,$/\n/'

nodes.name: Extract Unique IPs
nodes.notes: Get unique IP addresses for port scanning

parameters.command:
=# Run nmap scan on discovered IPs or direct target
target="{{ $json.stdout || $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.target }}"
echo "Running nmap scan on: $target"

nmap -sT -sV -sC -p- -T4 --min-parallelism 40 --max-parallelism 250 --max-retries 2 -oX /tmp/nmap_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.xml "$target"

cat /tmp/nmap_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.xml

nodes.name: Parse Nmap Results
nodes.notes: Extract all services with version details

parameters.command:
=# Nuclei Vulnerability Scanning
echo "Running nuclei on {{ $json.count }} URLs..."

# Create URL list for nuclei
echo '{{ $json.urls.join("\n") }}' > /tmp/nuclei_targets_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt

# Run nuclei with all templates
nuclei -l /tmp/nuclei_targets_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.txt -json -o /tmp/nuclei_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.json -severity critical,high,medium,low,info -rate-limit 150 -bulk-size 25 -timeout 10

echo "Nuclei scan complete. Found $(wc -l < /tmp/nuclei_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.json) vulnerabilities"
cat /tmp/nuclei_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.json

nodes.name: Nuclei Vulnerability Scan
nodes.notes: Automated vulnerability scanning with nuclei templates

nodes.name: CVE Enrichment (NVD)
nodes.notes: Query NVD API for CVE data

nodes.name: Prepare Comprehensive Report
nodes.notes: Aggregate all scan data into unified report

nodes.name: Generate Comprehensive HTML Report
nodes.notes: Create detailed HTML report with all findings

parameters.command:
=# Install PrinceXML and convert to PDF
apk add wget
cd /tmp

if [ ! -f prince-16.1-alpine3.20-x86_64.tar.gz ]; then
  wget https://www.princexml.com/download/prince-16.1-alpine3.20-x86_64.tar.gz
  tar -xf prince-16.1-alpine3.20-x86_64.tar.gz
fi

/tmp/prince-16.1-alpine3.20-x86_64/lib/prince/bin/prince /tmp/comprehensive_report_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.html -o /tmp/comprehensive_report_{{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.timestamp }}.pdf --media=print --encrypt --user-password={{ $('1. Set Parameters').item.json.report_password }} --css-dpi=128

echo "PDF report generated successfully"

parameters.content:
## ADVANCED ATTACK SURFACE SCANNER

**Capabilities:**
- Subdomain enumeration (subfinder + amass)
- DNS resolution and WHOIS lookup
- HTTP service discovery (httpx)
- Port scanning (nmap)
- Vulnerability scanning (nuclei)
- CVE enrichment (NVD API)
- Password-protected PDF reports

**Tools Integrated:**
- subfinder: Passive subdomain discovery
- amass: OSINT attack surface mapping
- httpx: Fast HTTP probing
- nuclei: Automated vulnerability scanning
- nmap: Port and service detection
- dig/whois: DNS and domain intelligence

**Setup:**
1. Update 'Pre-Set-Target' node with your target
2. Set report password in '1. Set Parameters'
3. First run auto-installs all tools
4. Choose trigger: webhook, form, manual, or scheduled
